intro: Mammillaria variamamma, commonly known as the variable mammillary cactus, is a species native to Mexico. It is characterized by its compact, spherical shape and is covered in white to yellow spines. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and hardy nature, it is a popular choice for cactus enthusiasts.
